vision.notes: Sensory capabilities are generally poorly documented at the family level for rotifers. Visual capabilities, if present, are unknown in detail.

chemoreception.notes: As microscopic aquatic organisms, rotifers rely heavily on chemoreception for finding food and mates. This is inferred but considered common to all rotifers.

mechanoreception.notes: Likely crucial for detecting water currents and substrate vibrations, aiding in locomotion and feeding. Inferred presence based on general rotifer biology.
